alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 06 at 1:58PM CDT until August 06 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois and Iowa, including the following areas, in Illinois, Bureau, Henry IL, Mercer, Putnam and Rock Island. In Iowa, Louisa, Muscatine and Scott. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms will be seen late this afternoon and tonight. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible. The area most at risk is along the Mississippi and south of Interstate 80. Total rainfall will vary, ranging from 1 to 4 inches with isolated higher amounts.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
